being or relating to an autosome (= a chromosome other than one that determines the sex of an animal or plant): Some genetic diseases are characterized by the absence or deletion of part of an autosomal chromosome. The tumours affecting the central nervous system show a pattern of inheritance as autosomal dominant traits.
More examplesFewer examplesTay-Sachs disease affects people from a variety of ethnic backgrounds and is transmitted as an autosomal recessive trait.In the majority of affected families studied, the lesions were inherited in an autosomal dominant manner.
